intro: Prestoea dasystachys, commonly known as the giant poinciana, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, showy, bipinnate leaves and clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has a straight, cylindrical trunk and can grow up to 30 meters tall, making it a prominent feature in its natural habitat. Its wood is strong and durable, historically used for construction and furniture. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
